de.systemagmbh.interfaces.splashscreen
Interface ISysSplashScreen

public interface ISysSplashScreen

This interface has to be implemented to create a splash screen using the factory class FSysSplashScreen. The items that are necessary for running the splash screen have to be passed as ISysConfigItem.


The implementation has to describe in the init method how the ISysConfigItem has to look like to run the splash screen.

The factory will call the init method to start the splash screen.

While the splash screen is open its status can be updated to inform the user about the current progress.

The splash screen has to be closed from outside. This will normally happen when the progress reaches 100% or at error conditions when starting the application.

Version:
$Revision: 1.1 $
Author:
Udo Friedrich

Method Detail

init

public void init(String frameTitle,
                 ISysStartInterruptable interruptable,
                 String version,
                 ISysConfigItem configItem)
          throws IOException
This class defines the interface for a window that appears when the program is started.

Parameters:
frameTitle - The title of the splash screen frame.
interruptable - A class that can handle the shutdown of the starting application.
version - The version of the program that is started.
configItem - The ISysConfigItem that contains all items needed by the implementation of this interface.
Throws:
IOException

getCurrentProgress

public int getCurrentProgress()
Get the current set value of the progress.

Returns:
the current set value of the progress.

setCurrentProgress

public void setCurrentProgress(String statusText,
                               int progress)
Set the current progress of the application.

Parameters:
statusText - A text that stands for the action that is performed next.
(To be displayed.)
progress - The current value for the progress.
(100 means 100 %; thus the value should not exceed 100.)
(To be displayed.)

dispose

public void dispose()
To be able to close the StartScreen any time you want.
(Normally it will be closed when the program is loaded. That is, when for example the progress bar is set to 100 percent by an event (-> CSysProgressStatusEvent).)
